-MTzE-Iyg1hPu2pJCH5k.headline: To end HIV epidemic, we must address health disparities
-MTzE-Iyg1hPu2pJCH5k.snippet: Expert report cites unequal progress in Southern U.S. and among marginalized groups.

-MTzE-RoTn5CyDfM5CPp.headline: NIH funds study to evaluate remdesivir for COVID-19 in pregnancy
-MTzE-RoTn5CyDfM5CPp.snippet: The study will be conducted at 17 sites in the continental United States and Puerto Rico.

-MTzE-VkXvgCK-WwSDmI.headline: Genetic study of Lewy body dementia supports ties to Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases
-MTzE-VkXvgCK-WwSDmI.snippet: NIH-led study locates five genes that may play a critical role in Lewy body dementia.

-MTzE-YJ2ZLSBG3ng5BZ.headline: Combination treatment for common glioma type shows promise in mice
-MTzE-YJ2ZLSBG3ng5BZ.snippet: NIH-funded preclinical study suggests new approach to treat a type of brain tumor

-MTzE-e6--AT8alC2pFY.headline: Researchers propose that humidity from masks may lessen severity of COVID-19
-MTzE-e6--AT8alC2pFY.snippet: NIH study compares how different face masks affect humidity inside the mask.

-MTzE-hyTCCaIu3Evjx1.headline: Study Identifies Risk Factors for Elevated Anxiety in Young Adults During COVID-19 Pandemic
-MTzE-hyTCCaIu3Evjx1.snippet: Findings on impact of childhood temperament could help with anxiety prevention efforts.

-MTzE-phfyLY7h3fncJw.headline: NIH experts discuss SARS-CoV-2 viral variants
-MTzE-phfyLY7h3fncJw.snippet: Editorial emphasizes need for global response.

-MTzE-tQJnntaD7yLYju.headline: Four potential COVID-19 therapeutics enter Phase 2/3 testing in NIH ACTIV-2 trial
-MTzE-tQJnntaD7yLYju.snippet: The added sub-studies will test four interventions for safety and efficacy.

-MTzE-wTqnHjWxpZXJE0.headline: NIH calls for greater inclusion of pregnant and lactating people in COVID-19 vaccine research
-MTzE-wTqnHjWxpZXJE0.snippet: Obstacles to include pregnant and lactating people in clinical research are longstanding.

-MTzE0-1TD6FqQx-Lcct.headline: CDC MEDIA TELEBRIEFING: National Forum on COVID-19 Vaccine
-MTzE0-1TD6FqQx-Lcct.snippet: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is hosting a virtual National Forum on COVID-19 Vaccine for vaccine practitioners and champions.

-MTzE08Eeaa7ms3U65fY.headline: CDC Food Safety Alert: CDC investigating fast-moving outbreak of Listeria infections
-MTzE08Eeaa7ms3U65fY.snippet: A CDC food safety alert regarding a multistate outbreak of Listeria infections linked to Hispanic-style fresh and soft cheeses has been posted: https://www.cdc.gov/listeria/outbreaks/hispanic-soft-cheese-02-21/index.html

-MTzE0SxjaG3X-930zGd.headline: Clinical Trials Are Moving Out of the Lab and Into People’s Homes
-MTzE0SxjaG3X-930zGd.snippet: After the pandemic forced thousands of trials to shut down, researchers found clever ways to conduct human studies remotely — while reaching more people, quickly and cheaply.

-MTzE0UTd9-kq6QCNfRn.headline: Scientists Call on CDC to Set Air Standards for Workplaces, Now
-MTzE0UTd9-kq6QCNfRn.snippet: The agency has not fully reckoned with airborne transmission of the coronavirus in settings like hospitals, schools and meatpacking plants, experts said.

-MTzE0XviMldeJDlaPTu.headline: Some Teens Volunteer for Covid Vaccine Trials to Get Their Lives Back
-MTzE0XviMldeJDlaPTu.snippet: Immunizing teenagers is a critical part of slowing the pandemic and reaching herd immunity. But enrolling them in clinical trials poses challenges that are very different than wrangling adults.

-MTzE0bZBVufmiwHBF6a.headline: Covid-Linked Syndrome in Children Is Growing, and Cases Are More Severe
-MTzE0bZBVufmiwHBF6a.snippet: The condition, which usually emerges several weeks after infection, is still rare, but can be dangerous. “A higher percentage of them are really critically ill,” one doctor said.

-MTzE0eOG3_BzkNOhqnK.headline: Piecing Together the Next Pandemic
-MTzE0eOG3_BzkNOhqnK.snippet: From a small lab in Cambodia, Dr. Jessica Manning is on the lookout for emerging diseases.

-MTzE0fwLXt8Qh7uJu4h.headline: 7 Virus Variants Found in U.S. Carrying the Same Mutation
-MTzE0fwLXt8Qh7uJu4h.snippet: Scientists don’t know yet whether the mutation makes the variants more contagious, but they are concerned that it might.

-MTzE0l9s2p6WEigeh0I.headline: W.H.O. Researcher Seeking Coronavirus Origins on His Trip to China
-MTzE0l9s2p6WEigeh0I.snippet: An interview with Peter Daszak, an animal disease specialist, just after his return from an investigative research mission to Wuhan, the site of the original Covid outbreak, and surrounding areas.
